definition: lit. one strong beat and one weak beats in a measure of music (two beats in the bar) (idiom); fig. follow a prescribed pattern to the letter/scrupulous attention to detail
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
board/plank/plate/shutter/table tennis bat/clappers (music)/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/accented beat in Chinese music/hard/stiff/to stop smiling or look serious
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: Previously, always think about line, so why every rhythm.
sentences.chinese: 以前，總以爲差不多就行了，何須如此一板一眼。

sentences.english: But can education ever be mapped out in such prescriptive terms?
sentences.chinese: 但是教育真的可以被那樣一板一眼地籌劃嗎？

sentences.english: Does the civil servant's career go like clockwork?
sentences.chinese: 公務員生涯，就像打卡鐘那麼一板一眼？

definition: not one thread loose (idiom); strictly according to the rules/meticulous/not one hair out of place
everything clear and orderly (idiom); neat and tidy
to follow the compass and go with the set square (idiom); to follow the rules inflexibly/to act according to convention
everything steady and stable (idiom); overcautious and unimaginary
